description.en: During the course, students can participate in article writing process from writing  title, abstract and introduction to the skill of answering to the reviewer. Seminars and active disucssions are aimed at giving tricks and advice in order to cope better with writing skills.
description.et: Kursuse käigus on tudengil võimalus osaleda akadeemilise kirjutamise protsessis alates pealkirja panemisest, abstrakti ja sissejuhatuse kirjutamisest kuni retsensendile vastamise oskusega. Seminaride ja aktiivsele osalusele suunatud arutelude kaudu saavad tudengid nippe ja soovitusi, kuidas artikli kirjutamisega paremini hakkama saada.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the process of writing and publishing a research paper in social sciences. During the course, process of article writing is going to be taken apart and through the seminars, support is provided for the doctoral students in the phase of article-writing.
objectives.et: Teadusartikli publitseerimine sotsiaalteadustes aine eesmärgiks on tutvustada teadusartikli kirjutamise/avaldamise protsessi sotsiaalteadustes. Kursuse raames võetakse artikli kirjutamise protsess elementideks ning pakutakse seminaride näol tuge artikli-kirjutamise faasis olevatele doktorantidele.

learning_outcomes.et:
Tudeng mõistab nõudmisi oma valdkonna teaduspublikatsioonidele.
Tudeng mõistab ja analüüsib artikli kirjutamise erinevaid elemente.
Tudeng teab retsenseerimise protsessist ja suudab selles osaleda.

description.et: Make use of the materials and knowledge from the last meeting and write a short methods/sample of for you next manuscript. Approximately 800-1000 words.
Make use of the materials and knowledge from the last meeting and write a Results section to your next manuscript. Approximately 1000-1500 words.
Make use of the materials and knowledge from the last meeting and write a Discussion section to your next manuscript. Approximately 1000-1500 words.
Act as a reviewer and write a review to a research paper.The paper and the review form will be provided by the lecturer.

grade_preconditions.et: Students need to be present and take active part in the seminar in 75% of the cases.

grade_evaluation.et:
Students need to carry out practical assignments during the seminars. 
A homework assignment need to be uploaded into the Moodle forum two days prior each meeting.

arvestatud.et: All written home assignments need to be submitted

debt_elimination.et: Missed seminar assignments can be completed at home and need to be submitted by the last week of the semester.

resources.mandatory_materials: Independent reading materials will be provided during seminars or given before the seminar through OIS.
resources.recommended_materials:
Blakie, N. 2010 Designing Social Research.
Manchester University has a great writing support resource: http://www.phrasebank.manchester.ac.uk/

Pinker, S. 2014 Why Academic writing stinks http://chronicle.com/article/Why-Academics-Stink-at/149105/

Recommended study materials will be available in moodle environment.
